headline: Verizon Offers $20 Credits After Resolving Outage Affecting Millions
summary: Tracking site Downdetector said it received 2.3 million reports of outages in the 24-hours starting Wednesday at 11 a.m. Eastern time.

headline: Inseego: Preferred Stock Repurchase Is Positive But Downgrading On Margin Headwinds
summary: While the preferred stock repurchase should be considered positive, higher investments in combination with skyrocketing memory prices are likely to negatively impact margins.

headline: Verizon Issues $20 Credits to Customers Affected by Outage
summary: “Yesterday, we did not meet the standard of excellence our customers expect and that we expect of ourselves,” Verizon said in a statement Thursday morning.  The company is offering $20 account credits, which should cover “multiple days of service.”  People began noticing service disruptions shortly before noon in New York, according to Downdetector.

headline: Customers Rate T-Mobile as the Network Quality Leader in the Most U.S. Regions
summary: BELLEVUE, Wash., January 15, 2026--T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS) today announced a watershed moment for the wireless industry: for the first time ever, customers have rated T-Mobile highest for network quality in five of six U.S. regions in the J.D. Power 2026 U.S. Wireless Network Quality Study - a decisive shift signaling a new era of network leadership.

headline: Strength Seen in Array Digital (AD): Can Its 6.6% Jump Turn into More Strength?
summary: Array Digital (AD) witnessed a jump in share price last session on above-average trading volume. The latest trend in earnings estimate revisions for the stock doesn't suggest further strength down the road.

headline: Trade Tracker: Bill Baruch sells T-Mobile and buys more Cheniere, SLB and ExxonMobil
summary: Bill Baruch, Founder & President Blue Line Capital, joins CNBC’s “Halftime Report” to detail his latest portfolio moves. The Committee shares their energy strategy.

headline: Wireless Network Quality Continues to Drive Competition as Customer Demands Grow, J.D. Power Finds
summary: TROY, Mich., January 15, 2026--J.D. Power: Wireless Network Quality Continues to Drive Competition as Customer Demands Grow
